thread.title: Wong still dealing with pain from outfield spill at Wrigley
thread.title_full: Wong still dealing with pain from outfield spill at Wrigley

title: Wong still dealing with pain from outfield spill at Wrigley
text:
Wong still dealing with pain from outfield spill at Wrigley Kolten Wong is still dealing with shoulder pain after an awkward fall in the outfield last September. DAVID BANKS/AP Feb 25, 2017 at 8:35p ET 0Shares 
JUPITER, Fla. — Kolten Wong is still bothered by a right shoulder injury from a tumble he took while playing left field last September at Wrigley Field. 
The St. Louis Cardinals second baseman said Saturday he’s been dealing with “tenderness” in the shoulder. He received a cortisone shot at the end of the season, and the right-handed thrower didn’t toss a baseball until January. 
“As soon as I started throwing, I could feel the pain right away,” Wong said. 
The shoulder still hurts when he throws. He has had an MRI but said he does “not yet” need surgery.
